content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 595.17 - Transition from part 586 to part 595

State Regulations
(a) Programs certified pursuant to Part 586 of this Title may continue to operate
pursuant to the requirements of Part 586 of this Title until the expiration of
the term of their operating certificate. (b) Upon the expiration of an operating
certificate issued pursuant to Part 586 of this Title, a provider may: (1)
return its operating certificate to the

Office of Mental Health; or
(2)
apply for an operating certificate as a program established under this

Part. (c) An application
for transition to this Part may be made prior to the expiration of the
program's existing operating certificate. (d) No residential program, including a
residential care center for adults, shall exceed the certified capacity
requirements delineated in section
595.5
(b) of this

Part, unless it was in operation prior to the effective date of these
regulations, and had been issued a valid operating certificate authorizing a
greater number of beds. (e) Programs licensed prior to the effective date of these regulations are exempt
from meeting the requirements of section
595.15
(a)(2)(i)
of this Part. (f) Programs not yet
licensed, but with Office of Mental Health architectural approval as of the
effective date of these regulations, may apply to the Office of Mental Health
for permission to meet the architectural standards of Part 586 rather than Part
595. Notes
